map.name: Town Square
map.description: You find yourself in the Town Square. A wide expanse of cobblestone, the square is a bustling hub of activity. Merchants hawk their wares from stalls lining the perimeter, while townsfolk mill about, chatting and trading. A grand fountain, depicting a mythical griffin, stands proudly in the center of the square, its waters shimmering in the midday sun. To the east stands a sturdy stone library, its arched windows promising a wealth of knowledge within. A small, well-worn path leads west, presumably towards the residential area of town.

map.name: Town
map.description: The Town stretches before you, a network of shops, houses, and public buildings lining a wide, cobbled street. People stream past, a constant flow of townsfolk going about their daily lives. A large notice board stands at the corner of the street, covered in various announcements and wanted posters. The midday sun glints off the tiled roofs of the buildings, creating a warm, inviting atmosphere. The rhythmic clang of a hammer on metal grows louder as you approach the town's smithy, a sturdy building with smoke billowing from its chimney. The smithy's door is slightly ajar.

map.name: The Armory
map.description: The Armory is a sturdy stone building, its facade dominated by large, reinforced windows showcasing an impressive array of weaponry and armor. Polished steel gleams under the light, and the rhythmic clang of a blacksmith's hammer echoes from within. The air smells of coal and hot metal. A sign above the door reads, 'The Armory - Steel for Every Need!'

map.name: Smithy
map.description: The Smithy is a sturdy building, its stone walls blackened with soot. A large, open doorway reveals a flurry of activity within – sparks fly as the smith works at his forge, hammering glowing metal into shape. The air is thick with the smell of coal smoke and hot iron. Various finished tools and weapons hang from the walls, glinting in the light. A burly figure, presumably the smith, is bent over his work, sweat dripping from his brow. A small anvil sits outside the doorway.

characters.name: Bob
characters.description: An ordinary man passing out newspaper

current scene.description:
The Smith grunts as he accepts the gold. "A fair price," he says, handing you three wickedly sharp daggers. They feel surprisingly light and balanced in your hands. "They'll serve you well enough," he adds, returning to his work. He wipes his brow again, a flicker of concern in his eyes. "You're looking a little pale. This heat is oppressive, even for me. Best be getting back out into the open air soon..."
